results.title: Cinemo Takes Automotive Infotainment to the Next Level with New In-car ...
results.content: LAS VEGAS, Nevada, January 09, 2024 - Cinemo, a global leader and highly innovative one-stop-shop provider for fully integrated digital media products, today announces a series of new in-car infotainment innovations that build on and continue to enrich its core product offerings—taking automotive digital media experiences to the next level.
results.raw_content:
9th January 2024
Events
News
Press
Cinemo Takes Automotive Infotainment to the Next Level with New In-car Digital Media Experiences at CES 2024
Cinemo reinforces its position as pioneer in multiscreen and multi-passenger digital media experiences in automotive, with in-car gaming, video conferencing, multi-zone audio, and further new use cases.
LAS VEGAS, Nevada, January 09, 2024 – Cinemo, a global leader and highly innovative one-stop-shop provider for fully integrated digital media products, today announces a series of new in-car infotainment innovations that build on and continue to enrich its core product offerings—taking automotive digital media experiences to the next level. Advanced multi-passenger use cases will be showcased at CES 2024 in Las Vegas from 9–12 January 2024 in the Santa Fe Suite #2922 at the Westgate Hotel.
Cinemo continues to redefine and shape the automotive digital media ecosystem, transforming the car cabin into a smart entertainment platform—bringing digital media experiences typically known from both home entertainment and work use cases into the car on both built-in screens and brought-in devices. CES visitors will see how the company remains the ultimate automotive infotainment pioneer, with innovation in in-car entertainment, immersive audio, video conferencing, and much more.
As screens increasingly become a necessity in modern software-defined vehicles, Cinemo’s unique multiscreen offering allows drivers and passengers to enjoy in-cabin gaming, audio and video on demand (VOD) content from premium content providers. Carmakers can easily provide popular music and video streaming services by relying on Cinemo’s established partner network and expertise to shorten development times, reduce total cost of ownership (TCO) and deliver cutting edge in-car entertainment.
Cinemo is also demonstrating the enablement of Dolby Atmos® for mainstream car models, giving more consumers the opportunity to enjoy immersive sound in their vehicles. In addition, Cinemo’s new multi-zone audio capability allows each passenger to enjoy their favorite content at the same time—with any app— even on their headphones or earphones.
Cinemo’s solution to turn video conferencing integrations into a multi-passenger experience redefines the way passengers connect to others on the move, by allowing every passenger to connect through their personal devices or the car’s built-in screens. This transforms the car into a mobile office or simply gives passengers the freedom to stay in touch with friends and family on the road.
In addition to the private Cinemo demos at Westgate, Cinemo can be experienced at CES 2024 at several live partner presentations over the four-day event:
BlackBerry IVY — [West Hall at Booth #4224]: BlackBerry will feature a show car with live demonstrations of its BlackBerry IVY® platform that delivers truly personalized content product offering, which, powered by Cinemo, provides content recommendations for a driver and passengers using age, occupancy monitoring, driver identification.
Robert Bosch GmbH — [Central Hall at Booth #17207]: Robert Bosch GmbH will be showcasing CARS™ Premium Audio, CARS™ Online Video, CARS™ Projection, the full portfolio of Cinemo based on Android Automotive OS, in a special Bosch demonstration vehicle created for CES.
Dolby – Dolby will showcase production cars with immersive Dolby Atmos audio, which is supported by Cinemo’s CARS Premium Audio.
MOBIS – [West Hall at Booth #5216]: Based on Cinemo’s powerful CORE solutions, MOBIS will be showcasing an Android Application enabling passengers to distribute video playback from the head unit to built-in screens and brought-in devices.
P3 – [West Hall at Booth #6474]: P3’s infotainment system SPARQ OS, powered by an array of Cinemo CARS™ products, will show new use cases for passenger entertainment while charging and driving, which will be available in different automotive hardware platforms.
TomTom — [West Hall at Booth #W311 & #W312]: The company will be showing its Cinemo-enhanced TomTom Digital Cockpit offering—which features Cinemo CARS™ multiscreen and video technology seamlessly integrated with Android Automotive OS transforming car rides into a new realm of fun and enjoyment.
“Entertainment is fast becoming integral to the entire car experience,” says Richard Lesser, CEO of Cinemo. “CES 2024 will show conclusively how more and more content providers and OEMs are getting on board with our own mission of transforming the car cockpit into a unique and highly desirable digital destination.”

Cinemo received the Top Company 2024 award by kununu for the third consecutive year! This recognition is

Whether embedded, as mobile apps or through the cloud, Cinemo offers digital media products for any industry.

Cinemo Takes Automotive Infotainment to the Next Level with New In-car Digital Media Experiences at CES 2024
Cinemo Takes Automotive Infotainment to the Next Level with New In-car Digital Media Experiences at CES 2024
Cinemo reinforces its position as pioneer in multiscreen and multi-passenger digital media experiences in automotive, with in-car gaming, video conferencing, multi-zone audio, and further new use cases.
Cinemo, a global leader and highly innovative one-stop-shop provider for fully integrated digital media products, today announces a series of new in-car infotainment innovations that build on and continue to enrich its core product offerings—taking automotive digital media experiences to the next level. Advanced multi-passenger use cases will be showcased at CES 2024 in Las Vegas from 9–12 January 2024 in the Santa Fe Suite #2922 at the Westgate Hotel.
Cinemo continues to redefine and shape the automotive digital media ecosystem, transforming the car cabin into a smart entertainment platform—bringing digital media experiences typically known from both home entertainment and work use cases into the car on both built-in screens and brought-in devices. CES visitors will see how the company remains the ultimate automotive infotainment pioneer, with innovation in in-car entertainment, immersive audio, video conferencing, and much more.
As screens increasingly become a necessity in modern software-defined vehicles, Cinemo’s unique multiscreen offering allows drivers and passengers to enjoy in-cabin gaming, audio and video on demand (VOD) content from premium content providers. Carmakers can easily provide popular music and video streaming services by relying on Cinemo’s established partner network and expertise to shorten development times, reduce total cost of ownership (TCO) and deliver cutting edge in-car entertainment.
Cinemo is also demonstrating the enablement of Dolby Atmos® for mainstream car models, giving more consumers the opportunity to enjoy immersive sound in their vehicles. In addition, Cinemo’s new multi-zone audio capability allows each passenger to enjoy their favorite content at the same time—with any app— even on their headphones or earphones.
Cinemo’s solution to turn video conferencing integrations into a multi-passenger experience redefines the way passengers connect to others on the move, by allowing every passenger to connect through their personal devices or the car’s built-in screens. This transforms the car into a mobile office or simply gives passengers the freedom to stay in touch with friends and family on the road.
In addition to the private Cinemo demos at Westgate, Cinemo can be experienced at CES 2024 at several live partner presentations over the four-day event:
BlackBerry IVY — [West Hall at Booth #4224]: BlackBerry will feature a show car with live demonstrations of its BlackBerry IVY® platform that delivers truly personalized content product offering, which, powered by Cinemo, provides content recommendations for a driver and passengers using age, occupancy monitoring, driver identification.
Robert Bosch GmbH — [Central Hall at Booth #17207]: Robert Bosch GmbH will be showcasing CARS™ Premium Audio, CARS™ Online Video, CARS™ Projection, the full portfolio of Cinemo based on Android Automotive OS, in a special Bosch demonstration vehicle created for CES.
Dolby - Dolby will showcase production cars with immersive Dolby Atmos audio, which is supported by Cinemo’s CARS Premium Audio.
MOBIS - [West Hall at Booth #5216]: Based on Cinemo’s powerful CORE solutions, MOBIS will be showcasing an Android Application enabling passengers to distribute video playback from the head unit to built-in screens and brought-in devices.
P3 - [West Hall at Booth #6474]: P3’s infotainment system SPARQ OS, powered by an array of Cinemo CARS™ products, will show new use cases for passenger entertainment while charging and driving, which will be available in different automotive hardware platforms.
TomTom — [West Hall at Booth #W311 & #W312]: The company will be showing its Cinemo-enhanced TomTom Digital Cockpit offering—which features Cinemo CARS™ multiscreen and video technology seamlessly integrated with Android Automotive OS transforming car rides into a new realm of fun and enjoyment.
“Entertainment is fast becoming integral to the entire car experience,” says Richard Lesser, CEO of Cinemo. “CES 2024 will show conclusively how more and more content providers and OEMs are getting on board with our own mission of transforming the car cockpit into a unique and highly desirable digital destination.”
About Cinemo
Cinemo is a global provider of highly innovative infotainment products that make every screen an opportunity. Its range of award-winning, fully integrated, low-footprint digital media offerings combine high performance with high quality and are truly system agnostic. Whether embedded as mobile apps or through the cloud, Cinemo supports all digital media scenarios for any industry and any device. Its product portfolio is designed and built to deliver excellence, accelerate time to market and lower TCO for its clients, while creating digital media experiences that matter.
Founded in 2008, and with a strong history of industry firsts, Cinemo is the partner of choice for more than 40 market-leading OEMs and over 20 tier-1s. The company works with the top high-tech and consumer electronic companies as well as global music and video content providers. Cinemo’s global team of 200+ innovative thinkers from 35 nationalities continuously delivers groundbreaking innovation.
Martina Oerther, Marketing Director, Cinemo
Email: moerther@cinemo.com

results.title: Cinemo unveils in-car infotainment innovations at CES 2024
results.content: LAS VEGAS, Nevada, January 09, 2024 - Cinemo announces a series of new in-car infotainment innovations that build on and continue to enrich its core product offerings—taking automotive digital media experiences to the next level. Advanced multi-passenger use cases will be showcased at CES 2024 in Las Vegas from 9-12 January 2024.
results.raw_content:
Cinemo unveils in-car infotainment innovations at CES 2024
LAS VEGAS, Nevada, January 09, 2024 – Cinemo announces a series of new in-car infotainment innovations that build on and continue to enrich its core product offerings—taking automotive digital media experiences to the next level. Advanced multi-passenger use cases will be showcased at CES 2024 in Las Vegas from 9–12 January 2024. The showcase will take place in the Santa Fe Suite #2922 at the Westgate Hotel.
Cinemo continues to redefine and shape the automotive digital media ecosystem. The company transforms the car cabin into a smart entertainment platform, bringing digital media experiences typically known from both home entertainment and work use cases into the car. This is achieved on both built-in screens and brought-in devices. CES visitors will see how the company remains the ultimate automotive infotainment pioneer. The company showcases innovation in in-car entertainment, immersive audio, video conferencing, and much more.
As screens increasingly become a necessity in modern software-defined vehicles, Cinemo’s unique multiscreen offering allows drivers and passengers to enjoy in-cabin gaming, audio and video on demand (VOD) content from premium content providers. Carmakers can leverage Cinemo’s established partner network and expertise to easily offer popular music and video streaming services. This approach helps shorten development times, reduce the total cost of ownership (TCO), and deliver cutting-edge in-car entertainment.
Cinemo is demonstrating the enablement of Dolby Atmos® for mainstream car models. Moreover, this provides more consumers with the opportunity to enjoy immersive sound in their vehicles. In addition, Cinemo’s new multi-zone audio capability allows each passenger to enjoy their favorite content at the same time. This rule is applicable to any app, and users can experience it through headphones or earphones.
Cinemo has developed a solution that transforms video conferencing integrations into a multi-passenger experience. This innovation revolutionizes how passengers connect with others while on the move. It enables each passenger to connect either through their personal devices or the car’s built-in screens. This transforms the car into a mobile office. It simply gives passengers the freedom to stay in touch with friends and family on the road.
Cinemo will showcase its capabilities not only through private demos at Westgate but also through live partner presentations during the four-day CES 2024 event.:
BlackBerry IVY — [West Hall at Booth #4224]: BlackBerry will showcase a show car with live demonstrations of its BlackBerry IVY® platform. Furthermore, this platform delivers a truly personalized content product offering, powered by Cinemo. It also provides content recommendations for a driver and passengers based on age, occupancy monitoring, and driver identification.
Robert Bosch GmbH — [Central Hall at Booth #17207]: Robert Bosch GmbH will be showcasing CARS™ Premium Audio, CARS™ Online Video, CARS™ Projection, and the full portfolio of Cinemo based on Android Automotive OS. Moreover, this will be presented in a special Bosch demonstration vehicle created for CES.
Dolby – Dolby will showcase production cars with immersive Dolby Atmos audio. Cinemo’s CARS Premium Audio supports this audio experience.
MOBIS – [West Hall at Booth #5216]: MOBIS will be showcasing an Android Application based on Cinemo’s powerful CORE solutions. This application enables passengers to distribute video playback from the head unit to built-in screens and brought-in devices.
P3 – [West Hall at Booth #6474]: P3’s infotainment system SPARQ OS, powered by an array of Cinemo CARS™ products, will showcase new use cases for passenger entertainment while charging and driving. These features will be available in different automotive hardware platforms.
TomTom — [West Hall at Booth #W311 & #W312]: The company will be showcasing its Cinemo-enhanced TomTom Digital Cockpit offering. This features Cinemo CARS™ multiscreen and video technology seamlessly integrated with Android Automotive OS. Moreover, the integration aims to transform car rides into a new realm of fun and enjoyment.
“Entertainment is fast becoming integral to the entire car experience,” says Richard Lesser, CEO of Cinemo. “CES 2024 will show conclusively how more and more content providers and OEMs are getting on board with our own mission of transforming the car cockpit into a unique and highly desirable digital destination.”
Related Articles

& BlackBerry team up for digital cockpit

Cinemo Takes Automotive Infotainment to the Next Level with New In-car Digital Media Experiences at CES 2024
Cinemo reinforces its position as pioneer in multiscreen and multi-passenger digital media experiences in automotive, with in-car gaming, video conferencing, multi-zone audio, and further new use cases.
LAS VEGAS, January 09, 2024--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Cinemo, a global leader and highly innovative one-stop-shop provider for fully integrated digital media products, today announces a series of new in-car infotainment innovations that build on and continue to enrich its core product offerings—taking automotive digital media experiences to the next level. Advanced multi-passenger use cases will be showcased at CES 2024 in Las Vegas from 9–12 January 2024 in the Santa Fe Suite #2922 at the Westgate Hotel.
Cinemo continues to redefine and shape the automotive digital media ecosystem, transforming the car cabin into a smart entertainment platform—bringing digital media experiences typically known from both home entertainment and work use cases into the car on both built-in screens and brought-in devices. CES visitors will see how the company remains the ultimate automotive infotainment pioneer, with innovation in in-car entertainment, immersive audio, video conferencing, and much more.
As screens increasingly become a necessity in modern software-defined vehicles, Cinemo’s unique multiscreen offering allows drivers and passengers to enjoy in-cabin gaming, audio and video on demand (VOD) content from premium content providers. Carmakers can easily provide popular music and video streaming services by relying on Cinemo’s established partner network and expertise to shorten development times, reduce total cost of ownership (TCO) and deliver cutting edge in-car entertainment.
Cinemo is also demonstrating the enablement of Dolby Atmos® for mainstream car models, giving more consumers the opportunity to enjoy immersive sound in their vehicles. In addition, Cinemo’s new multi-zone audio capability allows each passenger to enjoy their favorite content at the same time—with any app— even on their headphones or earphones.
Cinemo’s solution to turn video conferencing integrations into a multi-passenger experience redefines the way passengers connect to others on the move, by allowing every passenger to connect through their personal devices or the car’s built-in screens. This transforms the car into a mobile office or simply gives passengers the freedom to stay in touch with friends and family on the road.
In addition to the private Cinemo demos at Westgate, Cinemo can be experienced at CES 2024 at several live partner presentations over the four-day event:
BlackBerry IVY — [West Hall at Booth #4224]: BlackBerry will feature a show car with live demonstrations of its BlackBerry IVY® platform that delivers truly personalized content product offering, which, powered by Cinemo, provides content recommendations for a driver and passengers using age, occupancy monitoring, driver identification.
Robert Bosch GmbH — [Central Hall at Booth #17207]: Robert Bosch GmbH will be showcasing CARS™ Premium Audio, CARS™ Online Video, CARS™ Projection, the full portfolio of Cinemo based on Android Automotive OS, in a special Bosch demonstration vehicle created for CES.
Dolby - Dolby will showcase production cars with immersive Dolby Atmos audio, which is supported by Cinemo’s CARS Premium Audio.
MOBIS - [West Hall at Booth #5216]: Based on Cinemo’s powerful CORE solutions, MOBIS will be showcasing an Android Application enabling passengers to distribute video playback from the head unit to built-in screens and brought-in devices.
P3 - [West Hall at Booth #6474]: P3’s infotainment system SPARQ OS, powered by an array of Cinemo CARS™ products, will show new use cases for passenger entertainment while charging and driving, which will be available in different automotive hardware platforms.
TomTom — [West Hall at Booth #W311 & #W312]: The company will be showing its Cinemo-enhanced TomTom Digital Cockpit offering—which features Cinemo CARS™ multiscreen and video technology seamlessly integrated with Android Automotive OS transforming car rides into a new realm of fun and enjoyment.
"Entertainment is fast becoming integral to the entire car experience," says Richard Lesser, CEO of Cinemo. "CES 2024 will show conclusively how more and more content providers and OEMs are getting on board with our own mission of transforming the car cockpit into a unique and highly desirable digital destination."
About Cinemo
Cinemo is a global provider of highly innovative infotainment products that make every screen an opportunity. Its range of award-winning, fully integrated, low-footprint digital media offerings combine high performance with high quality and are truly system agnostic. Whether embedded as mobile apps or through the cloud, Cinemo supports all digital media scenarios for any industry and any device. Its product portfolio is designed and built to deliver excellence, accelerate time to market and lower TCO for its clients, while creating digital media experiences that matter.
Founded in 2008, and with a strong history of industry firsts, Cinemo is the partner of choice for more than 40 market-leading OEMs and over 20 tier-1s. The company works with the top high-tech and consumer electronic companies as well as global music and video content providers. Cinemo’s global team of 200+ innovative thinkers from 35 nationalities continuously delivers groundbreaking innovation.

Martina Oerther, Marketing Director, CinemoEmail: moerther@cinemo.com

results.title: Cinemo Takes Automotive Infotainment to the Next Level with New In-car ...
results.content: Cinemo reinforces its position as pioneer in multiscreen and multi-passenger digital media experiences in automotive, with in-car gaming, video conferencing, mu Cinemo Takes Automotive Infotainment to the Next Level with New In-car Digital Media Experiences at CES 2024 - Bodyworx Magazine
results.raw_content:
Cinemo Takes Automotive Infotainment to the Next Level with New In-car Digital Media Experiences at CES 2024
Cinemo reinforces its position as pioneer in multiscreen and multi-passenger digital media experiences in automotive, with in-car gaming, video conferencing, multi-zone audio, and further new use cases.
LAS VEGAS–(BUSINESS WIRE)–#VOD–Cinemo, a global leader and highly innovative one-stop-shop provider for fully integrated digital media products, today announces a series of new in-car infotainment innovations that build on and continue to enrich its core product offerings—taking automotive digital media experiences to the next level. Advanced multi-passenger use cases will be showcased at CES 2024 in Las Vegas from 9–12 January 2024 in the Santa Fe Suite #2922 at the Westgate Hotel.
Cinemo continues to redefine and shape the automotive digital media ecosystem, transforming the car cabin into a smart entertainment platform—bringing digital media experiences typically known from both home entertainment and work use cases into the car on both built-in screens and brought-in devices. CES visitors will see how the company remains the ultimate automotive infotainment pioneer, with innovation in in-car entertainment, immersive audio, video conferencing, and much more.
As screens increasingly become a necessity in modern software-defined vehicles, Cinemo’s unique multiscreen offering allows drivers and passengers to enjoy in-cabin gaming, audio and video on demand (VOD) content from premium content providers. Carmakers can easily provide popular music and video streaming services by relying on Cinemo’s established partner network and expertise to shorten development times, reduce total cost of ownership (TCO) and deliver cutting edge in-car entertainment.
Cinemo is also demonstrating the enablement of Dolby Atmos® for mainstream car models, giving more consumers the opportunity to enjoy immersive sound in their vehicles. In addition, Cinemo’s new multi-zone audio capability allows each passenger to enjoy their favorite content at the same time—with any app— even on their headphones or earphones.
Cinemo’s solution to turn video conferencing integrations into a multi-passenger experience redefines the way passengers connect to others on the move, by allowing every passenger to connect through their personal devices or the car’s built-in screens. This transforms the car into a mobile office or simply gives passengers the freedom to stay in touch with friends and family on the road.
In addition to the private Cinemo demos at Westgate, Cinemo can be experienced at CES 2024 at several live partner presentations over the four-day event:
BlackBerry IVY — [West Hall at Booth #4224]: BlackBerry will feature a show car with live demonstrations of its BlackBerry IVY® platform that delivers truly personalized content product offering, which, powered by Cinemo, provides content recommendations for a driver and passengers using age, occupancy monitoring, driver identification.
Robert Bosch GmbH — [Central Hall at Booth #17207]: Robert Bosch GmbH will be showcasing CARS™ Premium Audio, CARS™ Online Video, CARS™ Projection, the full portfolio of Cinemo based on Android Automotive OS, in a special Bosch demonstration vehicle created for CES.
Dolby – Dolby will showcase production cars with immersive Dolby Atmos audio, which is supported by Cinemo’s CARS Premium Audio.
MOBIS – [West Hall at Booth #5216]: Based on Cinemo’s powerful CORE solutions, MOBIS will be showcasing an Android Application enabling passengers to distribute video playback from the head unit to built-in screens and brought-in devices.
P3 – [West Hall at Booth #6474]: P3’s infotainment system SPARQ OS, powered by an array of Cinemo CARS™ products, will show new use cases for passenger entertainment while charging and driving, which will be available in different automotive hardware platforms.
TomTom — [West Hall at Booth #W311 & #W312]: The company will be showing its Cinemo-enhanced TomTom Digital Cockpit offering—which features Cinemo CARS™ multiscreen and video technology seamlessly integrated with Android Automotive OS transforming car rides into a new realm of fun and enjoyment.
“Entertainment is fast becoming integral to the entire car experience,” says Richard Lesser, CEO of Cinemo. “CES 2024 will show conclusively how more and more content providers and OEMs are getting on board with our own mission of transforming the car cockpit into a unique and highly desirable digital destination.”
About Cinemo
Cinemo is a global provider of highly innovative infotainment products that make every screen an opportunity. Its range of award-winning, fully integrated, low-footprint digital media offerings combine high performance with high quality and are truly system agnostic. Whether embedded as mobile apps or through the cloud, Cinemo supports all digital media scenarios for any industry and any device. Its product portfolio is designed and built to deliver excellence, accelerate time to market and lower TCO for its clients, while creating digital media experiences that matter.
Founded in 2008, and with a strong history of industry firsts, Cinemo is the partner of choice for more than 40 market-leading OEMs and over 20 tier-1s. The company works with the top high-tech and consumer electronic companies as well as global music and video content providers. Cinemo’s global team of 200+ innovative thinkers from 35 nationalities continuously delivers groundbreaking innovation.
